**Charles Matthew Hunnam** (born 10 April 1980)[1] is an English actor. He is
known for his roles as [Jackson "Jax" Teller](/wiki/Jax_Teller "Jax Teller")
in the [FX](/wiki/FX_\(TV_channel\) "FX \(TV channel\)") drama series _[Sons
of Anarchy](/wiki/Sons_of_Anarchy "Sons of Anarchy")_ (2008–14), Nathan
Maloney in the [Channel 4](/wiki/Channel_4 "Channel 4") drama _[Queer as
Folk](/wiki/Queer_as_Folk_\(UK_TV_series\) "Queer as Folk \(UK TV series\)")_
(1999–2000), Lloyd Haythe in the [Fox](/wiki/Fox_Broadcasting_Company "Fox
Broadcasting Company") comedy series _[Undeclared](/wiki/Undeclared
"Undeclared")_ (2001–02), [the title role](/wiki/Nicholas_Nickleby "Nicholas
Nickleby") in _[Nicholas Nickleby](/wiki/Nicholas_Nickleby_\(2002_film\)
"Nicholas Nickleby \(2002 film\)")_ (2002), Pete Dunham in _[Green
Street](/wiki/Green_Street_\(film\) "Green Street \(film\)")_ (2005), Raleigh
Becket in _[Pacific Rim](/wiki/Pacific_Rim_\(film\) "Pacific Rim \(film\)")_
(2013), [Percy Fawcett](/wiki/Percy_Fawcett "Percy Fawcett") in _[The Lost
City of Z](/wiki/The_Lost_City_of_Z_\(film\) "The Lost City of Z \(film\)")_
(2017), and in the title role of [Guy Ritchie](/wiki/Guy_Ritchie "Guy
Ritchie")'s _[King Arthur: Legend of the
Sword](/wiki/King_Arthur:_Legend_of_the_Sword "King Arthur: Legend of the
Sword")_ (2017).

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Charlie_Hunnam&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Hunnam was born in [Newcastle upon Tyne](/wiki/Newcastle_upon_Tyne "Newcastle
upon Tyne"), England, the son of William "Billy" Hunnam (1952–2013), a [scrap
metal](/wiki/Scrap_metal "Scrap metal") merchant, and Jane (née Bell) Hunnam,
a business owner. He lived in Australia from the age of 5 to 13 before moving
back to the United Kingdom.[2][3][4][5][6] His maternal grandmother was a
portrait artist in Newcastle.[7] Hunnam was the second child, born after
brother William "Billy". He has two younger half-brothers, Oliver and
Christian, on his mother's side.[8][9] His parents divorced when he was two
years old, and he moved to the village of [Melmerby,
Cumbria](/wiki/Melmerby,_Cumbria "Melmerby, Cumbria") when he was 12, as his
mother remarried. He went to [Heaton Manor School](/wiki/Heaton_Manor_School
"Heaton Manor School") in Newcastle. After moving, he went to [Ullswater
Community College](/wiki/Ullswater_Community_College "Ullswater Community
College") then [Queen Elizabeth Grammar
School](/wiki/Queen_Elizabeth_Grammar_School,_Penrith "Queen Elizabeth Grammar
School, Penrith") in [Penrith, Cumbria](/wiki/Penrith,_Cumbria "Penrith,
Cumbria").[10][11][12] He attended [Cumbria College of Art and
Design](/wiki/Cumbria_College_of_Art_and_Design "Cumbria College of Art and
Design"), now faculty of [University of Cumbria](/wiki/University_of_Cumbria
"University of Cumbria"), where he graduated with a degree in the
[theory](/wiki/Film_theory "Film theory") and [history of
film](/wiki/History_of_film "History of film") with a side in performing
arts.[13][14]

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Charlie_Hunnam&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

### Early
work[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Charlie_Hunnam&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early work")]

At the age of 17, Hunnam was discovered in a shoe shop on [Christmas
Eve](/wiki/Christmas_Eve "Christmas Eve") while drunkenly clowning around
buying shoes for his brother. A production manager for the Newcastle-based
children's show _[Byker Grove](/wiki/Byker_Grove "Byker Grove")_ approached
him and Hunnam was later cast in his first role as Jason in three episodes of
the show. He also had a brief modeling career where he did a shoot for Kangols
Caps and then decided modeling was not for him.[15][7][14][16] Aged 18, his
first major role came when he was cast by [Russell T
Davies](/wiki/Russell_T_Davies "Russell T Davies") as 15-year-old schoolboy
Nathan Maloney in Davies' [Channel 4](/wiki/Channel_4 "Channel 4") drama
_[Queer as Folk](/wiki/Queer_as_Folk_\(UK_TV_series\) "Queer as Folk \(UK TV
series\)")_.[17]

He followed this up with his role as Daz in the film _[Whatever Happened to
Harold Smith?](/wiki/Whatever_Happened_to_Harold_Smith%3F "Whatever Happened
to Harold Smith?")_ (1999) and then moved to the US.

His career expanded to include a recurring role as Gregor Ryder in the
[WB](/wiki/The_WB "The WB") series _[Young
Americans](/wiki/Young_Americans_\(TV_series\) "Young Americans \(TV
series\)")_. He then appeared in the short-lived
[Fox](/wiki/Fox_Broadcasting_Company "Fox Broadcasting Company") series
_[Undeclared](/wiki/Undeclared "Undeclared")_ as an English drama student
called Lloyd Haythe. Despite critical acclaim, the series was cancelled after
one season. Hunnam then appeared on the large screen in
_[Abandon](/wiki/Abandon_\(film\) "Abandon \(film\)")_ (2002), _[Nicholas
Nickleby](/wiki/Nicholas_Nickleby_\(2002_film\) "Nicholas Nickleby \(2002
film\)")_ (2002), and _[Cold Mountain](/wiki/Cold_Mountain_\(film\) "Cold
Mountain \(film\)")_ (2003). Hunnam has stated that he does not wish to simply
take any role that he is offered: "I have 60 years to make the money, but the
choices I make in the next five years are really going to define my career."
This decision resulted in his return to the UK to take the lead role of Pete
Dunham in the film _[Green Street](/wiki/Green_Street_\(film\) "Green Street
\(film\)")_ (2005), however his attempts at delivering a Cockney accent
resulted in his inclusion in many critics' "worst accents in movie history"
lists.[18]

Hunnam says his role Patric, a member of "The Fishes", in _[Children of
Men](/wiki/Children_of_Men "Children of Men")_ (2006), was the final part in
his "trilogy of mad men". "I played the psycho in _Cold Mountain_ , my
character in _Green Street_ is fairly psychotic and now I've got this
role."[19]

###
2008–2012[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Charlie_Hunnam&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: 2008–2012")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg/175px-
Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg)](/wiki/File:Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg "Enlarge")

Hunnam at the [San Diego Comic Con](/wiki/San_Diego_Comic_Con "San Diego Comic
Con"), 25 July 2010

From 2008 to 2014, Hunnam starred as [Jackson "Jax"
Teller](/wiki/Jackson_%22Jax%22_Teller "Jackson "Jax" Teller") in _[Sons of
Anarchy](/wiki/Sons_of_Anarchy "Sons of Anarchy")_ , a show about a prominent
motorcycle club in a small fictional California town. Hunnam was cast after
[Kurt Sutter](/wiki/Kurt_Sutter "Kurt Sutter"), the creator of the show, saw
him in _Green Street_.[20] His portrayal as Jax Teller has led Hunnam to
receive a [Critics' Choice Television
Award](/wiki/Critics%27_Choice_Television_Award "Critics' Choice Television
Award") nomination, three [EWwy Award](/wiki/EWwy_Award "EWwy Award")
nominations for Best Lead Actor in a Drama series, and a [PAAFTJ
Award](/wiki/Pan-American_Association_of_Film_%26_Television_Journalists "Pan-
American Association of Film & Television Journalists") nomination for Best
Cast in a Drama Series.[21][22][23][24]

In 2011, Hunnam played the role of Gavin Nichols in the philosophical
drama/thriller _[The Ledge](/wiki/The_Ledge_\(film\) "The Ledge \(film\)")_ by
[Matthew Chapman](/wiki/Matthew_Chapman_\(author\) "Matthew Chapman
\(author\)").[25]

In 2012, he starred as the title character in the indie comedy _[3,2,1...
Frankie Go Boom](/wiki/3,2,1..._Frankie_Go_Boom "3,2,1... Frankie Go Boom")_
alongside, among others, his _Sons of Anarchy_ co-star [Ron
Perlman](/wiki/Ron_Perlman "Ron Perlman").[26] Hunnam said that he considered
the day that he filmed scenes with Perlman for that film the best and funniest
day of filming he's ever had in his whole career.[27] He also appeared as Jay,
an ex-boxer, in [Stefan Ruzowitzky](/wiki/Stefan_Ruzowitzky "Stefan
Ruzowitzky")'s crime drama _[Deadfall](/wiki/Deadfall_\(2012_film\) "Deadfall
\(2012 film\)")_ (2012).[28][29]

###
2013–present[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Charlie_Hunnam&action=edit&section=5&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: 2013–present")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore_4.jpg/170px-
Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore_4.jpg)](/wiki/File:Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore_4.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Charlie_Hunnam_by_Gage_Skidmore_4.jpg "Enlarge")

Hunnam at the 2016 San Diego Comic Con International

Hunnam starred as Raleigh Becket in [Guillermo del
Toro](/wiki/Guillermo_del_Toro "Guillermo del Toro")'s sci-fi film _[Pacific
Rim](/wiki/Pacific_Rim_\(film\) "Pacific Rim \(film\)")_ ,[30] that opened in
July 2013 and grossed $411 million worldwide. It was announced on 2 September
2013 that Hunnam would play the lead role of Christian Grey in the [film
adaptation](/wiki/Fifty_Shades_of_Grey_\(film\) "Fifty Shades of Grey
\(film\)") of [E. L. James](/wiki/E._L._James "E. L. James")' novel _[Fifty
Shades of Grey](/wiki/Fifty_Shades_of_Grey "Fifty Shades of Grey")_.[31]
However, on 12 October 2013, [Universal Pictures](/wiki/Universal_Pictures
"Universal Pictures") announced that Hunnam had withdrawn from the film due to
conflicts with the schedule of his series _Sons of Anarchy_.[32]

On 2 June 2014, Hunnam was awarded a [Huading Award](/wiki/Huading_Awards
"Huading Awards") for Best Global Emerging Actor, for his role as Raleigh in
_Pacific Rim_ , due to the film performing very well in the Asian
markets.[33][34] Hunnam reunited with del Toro in the horror film _[Crimson
Peak](/wiki/Crimson_Peak "Crimson Peak")_ ,[35] alongside [Mia
Wasikowska](/wiki/Mia_Wasikowska "Mia Wasikowska"), [Tom
Hiddleston](/wiki/Tom_Hiddleston "Tom Hiddleston"), and [Jessica
Chastain](/wiki/Jessica_Chastain "Jessica Chastain"). The film began shooting
in February 2014, and was released on 16 October 2015.[36]

Hunnam starred as geographer [Percy Fawcett](/wiki/Percy_Fawcett "Percy
Fawcett") in [James Gray](/wiki/James_Gray_\(film_director\) "James Gray
\(film director\)")'s adventure drama _[The Lost City of
Z](/wiki/The_Lost_City_of_Z_\(film\) "The Lost City of Z \(film\)")_ , which
was filmed from August 2015 to October 2015, premiered at the [New York Film
Festival](/wiki/New_York_Film_Festival "New York Film Festival") in 2016, and
was released in April 2017.[37][38][39][40] Hunnam also starred in [Guy
Ritchie](/wiki/Guy_Ritchie "Guy Ritchie")'s action-adventure film _[King
Arthur: Legend of the Sword](/wiki/King_Arthur:_Legend_of_the_Sword "King
Arthur: Legend of the Sword")_ , which was filmed between March 2015 and July
2015, and was released in May 2017.[41]

###
Screenplays[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Charlie_Hunnam&action=edit&section=6&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Screenplays")]

Immediately prior to getting cast on _Sons of Anarchy_ , he sold his
screenplay _Vlad_ to [Summit Entertainment](/wiki/Summit_Entertainment "Summit
Entertainment") with [Brad Pitt](/wiki/Brad_Pitt "Brad Pitt")'s Plan B Studios
co-producing.[42] The film is being directed by music video director and
photographer [Anthony Mandler](/wiki/Anthony_Mandler "Anthony Mandler"), and
will focus on the real-life story of [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler
"Vlad the Impaler").[43] Hunnam learned the story from locals in
[Romania](/wiki/Romania "Romania") while shooting _Cold Mountain_. He stated
that he had not acted in 18 months and was so broke that if he had not managed
to sell the script he would have had to sell his house and move back to
[Britain](/wiki/UK "UK") to live with his mother.[44] Hunnam is also
developing a screenplay based on a 2011 _[Rolling
Stone](/wiki/Rolling_Stone_\(magazine\) "Rolling Stone \(magazine\)")_ article
that he optioned about [Edgar Valdez Villareal](/wiki/Edgar_Valdez_Villareal
"Edgar Valdez Villareal"), an American drug lord who ran one of the biggest
[cartels](/wiki/Drug_cartel "Drug cartel") in [Mexico](/wiki/Mexico
"Mexico").[45] Another project he has in development is a film about
[gypsy](/wiki/Romani_people "Romani people") culture in Britain, which he
hopes to direct. He stated that it's "a part of English society that's really
seldom been explored, but is one of the most colourful and interesting parts
of British society."[46]

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Charlie_Hunnam&action=edit&section=7&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

In 1999, Hunnam met actress Katharine Towne when they both auditioned for
roles on _[Dawson's Creek](/wiki/Dawson%27s_Creek "Dawson's Creek")_.[47]
After dating for three weeks, they married in [Las Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas "Las
Vegas"). They divorced in 2002.[17] Hunnam has been dating artist Morgana
McNelis since 2005.[48][49][50][51]
